messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] A DAIMYO WEBSITE - NEW???
messages.msgSnippet: Probably a typo for Yamanouchi .  There has been some opposing views as to whether it is Yamauchi or Yamanouchi (and I think there is evidence it has been
messages.messageBody:
Probably a typo for 'Yamanouchi'. There has been some opposing views
as to whether it is 'Yamauchi' or 'Yamanouchi' (and I think there is
evidence it has been pronounced both ways, but I could be mistaken).

-Josh

On Sat, Aug 2, 2008 at 10:47 AM, Kenji Sekiguchi <kenji@...> wrote:
> The yamauchi family is written yamanuchi. Which one is correct? Yamauchi or
> yamanuchi?
>
>
>
> Kenji Sekiguchi
>
>

>
> I pray it's not a copy of something well-known...
>
> Best regards,
> Barry Thomas.
> (Melbourne, Australia)

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] A DAIMYO WEBSITE - NEW???
messages.msgSnippet: But many gaijin can correctly use principal versus principle when writing in English (British, Aussie, Merican, or other variety.) ;-) Craig -- Craig
messages.messageBody:
But many gaijin can correctly use "principal" versus "principle" when
writing in English (British, Aussie, 'Merican, or other variety.) ;-)

Craig

--
Craig Harris
Bridge of Dreams, LLC
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com

THAT'S GAIJIN FOR YOU!!!
Barry Thomas.

----- Original Message -----
From: Kenji Sekiguchi
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, August 02, 2008 1:47 PM
Subject: RE: [samuraihistory] A DAIMYO WEBSITE - NEW???


The yamauchi family is written yamanuchi. Which one is correct? Yamauchi or
yamanuchi?

Kenji Sekiguchi

From: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com [mailto:samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com]
On Behalf Of Barry Thomas
Sent: Friday, August 01, 2008 8:49 PM
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [samuraihistory] A DAIMYO WEBSITE - NEW???

Dear All,

Trawling the web I stumbled across this website:
http://www.worldstatesmen.org/Japan_feud.html

I pray it's not a copy of something well-known...

Best regards,
Barry Thomas.
(Melbourne, Australia)
